text:
Mr. Dean Gregory
October 31, 1963
I want to be clear, Dean, that our interest la having the basic course
developed by someone else does not in any way represent any dissatisfaction
with your professional competence and ability. It was probably an
imposition in the first place to try to find one man who was not only an
accomplished linguist and teacher, but who was also an experienced radio
writer. We feel that this new arrangement has possibilities for
providing us with both talents within the same organisation, and that
this arrangement should enable us to move along with greater dispatch
to provide the materials to the Voice of America as soon as possible.
We would appreciate having you complete the materials upon which you
are working at the moment and sending them to us as soon as they are
finished.
Kind regards.
Sincerely,
JAP: sc
James A. Fellows
Assistant Director
